thread.title: Man pleads guilty to supplying weapons to San Bernardino terrorists
thread.title_full: Man pleads guilty to supplying weapons to San Bernardino terrorists

author: Paloma Esquivel
title: Man pleads guilty to supplying weapons to San Bernardino terrorists
text:
Man pleads guilty to supplying weapons to San Bernardino terrorists Enrique Marquez Jr. Bill Robles / Associated Press 
In this courtroom sketch, Enrique Marquez Jr. appears in federal court in Riverside on Dec. 21. 
In this courtroom sketch, Enrique Marquez Jr. appears in federal court in Riverside on Dec. 21. (Bill Robles / Associated Press) Paloma Esquivel , was charged in connection with the attacks in December 2015.
While he was not accused of taking part in the shooting , Marquez emerged as a central figure in the investigation after federal agents began to probe his ties to Farook. The two onetime neighbors had been close friends and began attending a mosque together in 2010. Even as Marquez told friends he hoped to enlist in the U.S. Navy, prosecutors say, he and Farook were secretly amassing weapons, discussing radical Islam and plotting terrorist attacks in California. 
According to court records, Marquez and Farook had plotted to launch attacks on the 91 Freeway in Corona and at Riverside City College in 2011 and 2012, but both plots were aborted, records show. 
In exchange for the guilty pleas, the government agreed to dismiss the other charges against him, although the judge can consider dismissed charges when deciding on a sentence for Marquez. 
Farook and his wife, Tashfeen Malik, were killed in a gun battle with police hours after the Dec. 2, 2015, attacks. The shootings at the Inland Regional Center left 14 people dead and 22 others injured. Caption 90 seconds: 4 stories you can't miss 
Trump's national security advisor Michael Flynn resigns , officials work frantically to drain water from Lake Oroville , Congress has been busy writing bills , and federal officials say they haven't broadened the scope of immigration enforcement raids . Caption 90 seconds: 4 stories you can't miss
